alert.note: Alert for Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 10:47PM CDT until May 16 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, Greene, Stone, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM CDT, Residual flooding from the heavy rain fall that occurred Monday evening will continue across the area overnight. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway C, Wolf Creek at Highway AB, Flat Creek at Highway U, Woods Fork at Woods Fork Road, James River at Bell Ford Road, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road and Finley River at Johns Ford Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Springfield, Ozark, Marshfield, Cassville, Strafford, Highlandville, Rogersville, Seymour, Sparta, Crane, Mansfield, Fordland, Hartville, Galena, Diggins, Dawson, Duncan, Mccord Bend, Hurley, Spokane, Bruner, Oldfield, Linden, Turners, Northview, Christian Center, Selmore, Odin, Ponce de Leon, Elsey, Wheelerville, Manes, Graff, Madry, Jenkins and Mcdowell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
